content:
Hello #genomics - We will be starting our first session of the WGM in about 7 minutes! This link should work:
https://whova.com/portal/webapp/hspaw_202109/Agenda/1806526

Next session starts in ~ 13 minutes: https://whova.com/portal/webapp/hspaw_202109/Agenda/1806527

To review redesigned General page:
http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/genomics-reporting/branches/kp-task-category-changes/general.html

Compared to:
http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/genomics-reporting/general.html

updated diagram 4 with adding in the current cardinalities:
image.png
Tried pulling back the detail on the different Observation types since that wasn't the main scope of the diagram and it got too hard to read in my opinion.
I like it. looks like there is an extra arrow from report to organization?
Looks great Jamie! Thanks for putting this together
Since you squeezed in 'supporting info' do we do away with fig 5 now?
That arrow is supposed to be from Task

I just pushed up a change to try out the new diagram. Once it builds (probably 5 mins or so), everyone can take a look and see what they think? http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/genomics-reporting/branches/kp-task-category-changes/general.html
I tried drawing out the observation class relations but got carried away thinking about the potential to derive implications from observations other than findings (e.g., TMB or supporting info)
Everyone take a look shortly and log reactions here :smile:
Build is completeâ€” see what you think with the new diagram
#genomics - First session of the day starts in about 10 minutes!

And don't forget, we have a joint session with FHIR-I, so make sure to join that session:
https://whova.com/portal/webapp/hspaw_202109/Agenda/1806569
image.png

Next session in 15 minutes! Joint with O&O, so remember to join the right stream:
image.png
Last session of the day starts in about 7 minutes! (Wanted to note that I will likely be late joining the session)

This drawing looks fantastic Jamie! Thank you so much for putting it together..... I assume that we can get rid of the grid behind the image shown in the link (when we are ready to embed the image in our IG web page).. We need to work on the text that should possibly go along with this image. I took the text that Kevin provided and simply put it into some categories/bullets. If we can decide the main points that we want to make about the elements in this drawing, I will try to write them up rough-edit-genomic-info.docx
@Arthur Hermann - You may want to start with the latest version of the page, I have been making some additional tweaks throughout the day.

I think you did a great job on that text! I think it can be the final version, once folks give it a review and provide comments.. Here is the link just to make it esy for folks to find - http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/genomics-reporting/branches/kp-task-category-changes/general.html
I would probably suggest everyone do a top -> bottom review , I did move around quite a bit. And finally broke down and wrote some new content.

I just looked at the page which has the updated text based on the JIRA referenced below. First - it doesn't contain the language that was provided. Where did this language come from? Second - it appears after the table of contents which is a lot of text. Why? It should be at the very top. Finally - and most importantly the text should clearly state that you should disregard this information and go to the current IG (with a link). I don't understand how we ended up with this "wimpy" change after so much work to get the change made... Here is the language specified in the JIRA - which is strong and to the point " The material on this page will be removed in a future release. This content is deprecated and SHOULD NOT be used. Implementers are instead directed to the Genomics Reporting Implementation Guide for guidance."

Arthur Hermann said:

Patrick when you confirm this information with OO - can you please be be sure that this notice is added at the very TOP of this page. Right now, you see the table of contents, THEN you see our statement about this not being the correct version of our IG. It should really be the first thing you see. We also want the link inside of this text to point to the 'best and newsest" version of our IG that we can. I would prefer to link to our continuous build version, but this may not be allowed. It would be great to understand when/how we can update the version this points to (is linked to) as we ballot new versions... feel free to reach out if you have questions about my statements...

For JIRA https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-28620
Link to outdated genomics content on the FHIR page to be fixed
This fix has been approved by FMG. JD will apply it this week to R4B.
Add more pages which will need the note. (Extensions, Profiles, Example)
Patrick Werner will create a list of pages
Patrick: participated in an OO call in a couple of weeks ago, annotations, OO will log a jira task for that: create extension on annotation, and create extension on code?
OO minutes: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/OO/2021-03-11+Main
CG will add extension in IG on annotation on the report (not a variant annotation)
OO may need to develop ID
OO may need to develop IDs for derived products, tweaking device pattern
https://confluence.hl7.org/display/OO/2021-08-2+HCP

@Arthur Hermann - I might need to defer to @John David Larkin Nolen but the R4B version of our Genomics page can be seen here (that has the 'dragon' warning JD added):
https://build.fhir.org/branches/R4B/genomics.html
That is great @Kevin Power ! I think the problem is that the published page does not show that branch. @John David Larkin Nolen , I hate to ask, but can you look into this?

Arthur Hermann said:

I think the problem is that the published page does not show that branch.

Just to confirm, what 'published page' are you looking at?

Last message of the day (I guess :smile:) - In a side conversation with @Hayden Bader about the Grouper on FHIR-32085, I pushed up one more change:

http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/genomics-reporting/branches/kp-task-category-changes/general.html#grouper

I understand that we should probably clean up that diagram, but we have others to clean up, and wanted to see what others though of it.
I am talking about the page which you reach when you click "Genomics" on this main FHIR Page: http://hl7.org/fhir/
This will be changed as soon R4B is the current normative release.
When will that be Patrick? I thought that the release was taking place a while ago. A real ease date would be great! Thank you
#genomics - First session of Wednesday coming up shortly!

I converted the page Kevin has been working onto a Word doc which is now on the CG's Google Drive (link follows).
Member's of the WG - PLEASE review this doc and make any comments and suggested edits that you feel should be applied. Why don't we give people two weeks for review (which means all suggested edits/changes should be in place by October 6th. Doc is at: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xQ4cgvVoXUrKS_jVA4yP_Uy39KJLlu5J/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=112991217946311588811&rtpof=true&sd=true :work_in_progress:
